properties.areaDesc: San Juan and Vicinity; North Central; Northwest; Mayaguez and Vicinity; St Croix
properties.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 31 at 3:38PM AST until August 31 at 5:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heat indices values of 108 to 111 degrees Fahrenheit.

* WHERE...Coastal and urban areas of the east and south, as well
as the valleys of the eastern interior in Puerto Rico.

* WHEN...Through 5 PM AST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Heat exhaustion is probable with prolonged exposure.
properties.instruction:
A Heat Advisory means that a period of hot temperatures is
expected. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity
will combine to create a situation in which heat illnesses are
possible. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned
room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and
neighbors.

To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and
Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks
in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat
should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an
emergency, call 9 1 1.

NWSheadline: HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IS CANCELLED

properties.areaDesc: Northeast; Southeast; Eastern Interior; Ponce and Vicinity; Southwest
properties.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 31 at 3:38PM AST until August 31 at 5:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heat indices values of 108 to 111 degrees Fahrenheit.

* WHERE...Coastal and urban areas of the east and south, as well
as the valleys of the eastern interior in Puerto Rico.

* WHEN...Through 5 PM AST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Heat exhaustion is probable with prolonged exposure.
properties.instruction:
Take extra precautions, if you work or spend time outside. When
possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or
evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat
stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible
and drink plenty of water.

To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and
Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks
in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat
should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an
emergency, call 9 1 1.

NWSheadline: HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON

properties.areaDesc: Culebra; Vieques; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands
properties.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 31 at 3:38PM AST until August 31 at 5:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heat indices values at or above 112 degrees Fahrenheit.

* WHERE...Urban and coastal areas of northern and western Puerto
Rico, Vieques, Culebra and all of the U.S. Virgin Islands.

* WHEN...Through 5 PM AST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Heat exhaustion is likely with prolonged exposure.
Heat stroke possible.
properties.instruction:
Take extra precautions, if you work or spend time outside. When
possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or
evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat
stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when
possible and drink plenty of water.

Young children and pets should never be left unattended in
vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during
warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal
temperatures in a matter of minutes.

NWSheadline: EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON

properties.areaDesc: Aguada, PR; Anasco, PR; Lares, PR; Las Marias, PR; Moca, PR; Rincon, PR; San Sebastian, PR
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 2:51PM AST until August 31 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive
rainfall is expected.

* WHERE...Aguada, Anasco, Lares, Las Marias, Moca, Rincon and San
Sebastian.

* WHEN...Until 600 PM AST.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Overflowing poor
drainage areas.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 250 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to
thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream
flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen.
- Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected
over the area. This additional rain will result in minor
flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include...
San Sebastian, Anasco, Las Marias, Aguada, Aguadilla, Lares,
Rincon, Hato Arriba, Luyando, La Playa, Espino, Juncal and
Stella.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

NWSheadline: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING

properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 2:19PM AST until August 31 at 5:30PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive
rainfall is expected.

* WHERE...Mayaguez.

* WHEN...Until 530 PM AST.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 218 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to
thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream
flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen.
- Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over
the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

NWSheadline: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON
